posts.title: Souvenirs From Ho Chi Minh City
posts.content:
## Bound notebooks and embossed luggage tags by Freewill Leather

In a small studio just north of downtown Ho Chi Minh City (HCMC), Thanh Huynh and her team create gorgeous custom leather products that range from bound field notebooks to sheaths for artist supplies, all at surprisingly reasonable prices. Using the design aesthetics and attention to detail gained from her background in interior design, Thanh creates bags inspired by Hoi An lanterns and batik from Sapa, as well as beautiful luggage tags stamped with a map of Vietnam (custom embossed for less than US$10). Products can be delivered to your hotel, or visit her workshop to choose your leather and design.

posts.title: Local Designers in Vietnam
posts.content:
## Custom-made jewelry made by Saigon Army

After trading English lessons with the daughter of a local blacksmith, special education teacher turned entrepreneurial blacksmith Greg Hitz picked up the skills to create minimalistic, unisex jewellery, some using old Indochinese currency and Vietnamese silver, hand-hammered up to 300 times. Greg says Saigon Armoryâ€™s simple designs 'encourage honesty and self-reflection, complementing the individual rather than the jewellery itself'. Saigon Armory can size customers at their hotel and deliver custom orders in two days.
